item.title: Jobfier-CTF walkthrough | TryHackMe
item.description: Jobfier-CTF walkthrough My friend sent me This LinkedIn post. Which is Jobfier’s team had prepared this task to find cyber-security professionals. My time had come. Let’s hack the box. Let’s start the machine and got its ip address. Our machine ip address is 10.10.50.121 Let do basic nmap scan to find open ports. As we can see port 80http and 6666ssh is open I open the page on the browser and catch request and response with BurpSuite.
item.content:
Jobfier-CTF walkthrough

My friend sent me This LinkedIn post. Which is Jobfier’s team had prepared this task to find cyber-security professionals. My time had come. Let’s hack the box.

Let’s start the machine and got its ip address.

Our machine ip address is 10.10.50.121

Let do basic nmap scan to find open ports. As we can see port 80http and 6666ssh is open

I open the page on the browser and catch request and response with BurpSuite.

We can see raphaelsportfolio.com as HTML comment.

Let’s add this domain to /etc/hosts file

Then open this link on your browser. You can scan this domain with dirb or gobuster to find available paths. I found password list on /robots.txt.

Save these passwords probably we will need this to attack the account.

I also found certificate image on website. There is mrrafael username on it. We have wordlist and username. Let’s find login page and try to find correct account password.

There was login button on website. No need additional effort to find this.

I try mrrafael as a username and password as a password. Then I did catch the request with BurpSuite. As you can see there are username (2) and password (1) fields. I sent this request to intruder.

I know username, I need just to find password. That’s why I add only password field to brute-force.

Every wrong passwords return 302(1) http status code (redirection), probably correct password also returns 302. This response also returns path (2) with Location header. Wrong passwords Location value is /accounts/login/. The correct password will return different Location value. that’s why we should follow redirection to analyze password is correct or not.

Load passwords which is we found it on /robots.txt.

Don’t forget to enable intruder’s Follow redirection (2). You can find it under the Options (1).

Start tha attack and analyze the results. As you can see payload 999999 differently return two times. Let’s check this.

Look at this. This response redirects us to /account/404.

Look at page, there is nothing.

If we open source code of this page we can see img tag, but we can’t see this image on page. because css display attribute’s value is none. That’s why we can’t see thi on the page.

Open the image. There are some hints for us.

Download image.

Use steghide tool to extract hidden data. Don’t forget to tell magic words.

  • please

We found url in flag1. Add this domain to /etc/hosts file. Then visit the website. keyword is ssh_key.

this link move us to another page. This page get value from path, runs something and returns a result.

Manually I enter ' '1'='1 sql injection payload after the previous code, and it returns all values. There is sql injection vulnerability on this page.

Let’s exploit this with sqlmap. If you don’t know sqlmap options, you can google it.

We found users table on this database. Look at this there is ssk_key column. That’s password we need this to connect server via ssh.

Let’s connect server.

This user’s default session is python. we need to change it to shell. use below commands to do it.

There is flag2.txt here, but we can’t read because we don’t have enough privilege to read this file and this file owner is another user.

We come to my favorite part: Linux privilege escalation For find possible escalation techniques you can use different scripts. In this situation I used linenum.sh. In order to transfer this file to target machine I used python script.

There was wget on target machine, and I downloaded it easily. Before the download you should change your directory to tmp. Because at there you can download and execute script.

I run it and found some privilege escalation vectors. One of them is that. find command’s SUID bit is active. We can run it with root privileges.

Use this command to gain root privileges.

Now we got the root privileges. We can read all files.

That’s all.

  • Mission completedâœ…

item.title: About Me
item.description: Who am I? The guy who wants to be tech God. HiðŸ‘‹, My name is Beyrak. I’m CS Student at Baku State University. I love to be in the technology industry. Because technology is developing every day. Even faster than the previous day. hence cyber-security is an inevitable part of this sector. I’m very interested in cyber-security. I’m learning cyber-security hands-on for 2 years, and I can say now cyber-security is part of my life.
item.content:
Who am I?

  • The guy who wants to be tech God.

HiðŸ‘‹, My name is Beyrak. I’m CS Student at Baku State University. I love to be in the technology industry. Because technology is developing every day. Even faster than the previous day. hence cyber-security is an inevitable part of this sector. I’m very interested in cyber-security. I’m learning cyber-security hands-on for 2 years, and I can say now cyber-security is part of my life. In addition, I love Linux, Coding and any things else about technology.

Skills âš¡

  • Cyber-Security -> Penetration testing | BurpSuit, Nmap, Metasploit
  • Digital Forensic -> FTK Imager | Volatility
  • Application Security -> Mobile/Web Fundamentals | HTML/JavaScript (Front&Backend knowledge)
  • Programming | Scripting -> Golang | Shell Scripting
  • Binary Exploitation -> Assembler Elementary
  • Basic Malware Analysis -> Static | Dynamic

Social

  • https://tryhackme.com/p/beyraklnc
  • https://github.com/beyrakIn
  • https://www.linkedin.com/in/beyrak/
  • https://beyrak.me/
  • ba@beyrak.me
